N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-4.7 - Motions and requests

State Regulations
(a) All
motions and requests prior to the hearing shall be submitted in writing to the
hearing officer or, where no hearing officer has been designated, to the
commission. Copies of motion papers shall be served upon all parties. Motions
made during the course of a hearing may be stated orally and shall be made a
part of the record. (b) The hearing
officer shall rule upon all motions and requests prior to the submission of his
report to the commission. The commission shall rule upon all motions and
requests submitted prior to designation of a hearing officer or after receipt
of the hearing officer's report. Notes
